Articles.Content:
I always wanted to play it, but could never get it to work.

I still have the old ROM Disk somewhere in the boxes from my move.

Moving from Seattle to Texas is fun!
My all time favorite game.

This:

It's from 2001-ish.

Edited July 10, 2013 by bigyihsuan
Roller Coaster Tycoon, for sure.

X-COM: UFO DEFENSE [1993]

The original game, not the new one:

It was infinitely re-playable, every mission map was generated randomly, it required significant planning and strategy and I wasted most of my youth on it.

I'll take good 'ol PD over COD any day of the week. Best theme song too.

Still has more weapon diversity than most shooters today, which is really sad. I still think secondary functions is the best idea this game featured in terms of combat. That and you (most of the time) don't die in two hits and have a chance to retaliate.

Edited July 11, 2013 by WhiteWeasel

My all time favorite game.

Mine too. I bought it on Steam recently because my original CD went missing during a move.

Also, System Shock 2 but only because the Ultima Underworld engine makes the first one nearly unplayable nowadays (CONTROLS!!!)

More recent ones:

My first RTS ever, graphics are terrible compared to today's standards but it was nonetheless a good game. (ok, still really old... I need to run through my game collection at home, we've got a ton of GameCube stuff, which reminds me...)

Yeah, I liked that too, I played it a lot. I still remember the music when you start the game up. Ta-da-tadadadaaa-ta-da-tadatataaa!

Yeah, I liked that too, I played it a lot. I still remember the music when you start the game up. Ta-da-tadadadaaa-ta-da-tadatataaa!

I would take my friend's trumpet in band class while he was away, and play that. By the end of the first year, my band teacher could remember that music.

i totally forgot my first console game ever.

i totally loved Naughty Dogs work, but Uncharted kinda never got me.

Thats easy: X-Com: Enemy Unknown

Not, not this one...

This one!

Oh, how many nights have I spent defending Earth from these aliens?

blasphemy!

the original was called "X-Com: UFO Defense" and/or "UFO: Enemy Unknown" (hence why they named the new "remake" "X-Com: Enemy Unknown")

but I totally agree original X-Com for the win and possibly terror from the deep

You kids today and your definitions of "old."

UT2K4 is probably my favorite new old game. Reaching further back, I'm still a fan of Adventure from Atari. You can find clones around even now. And I still play Bejeweled on my phone.

You kids today and your definitions of "old."

UT2K4 is probably my favorite new old game. Reaching further back, I'm still a fan of Adventure from Atari. You can find clones around even now. And I still play Bejeweled on my phone.

Well, true video games have only been around since 1962, starting with Spacewar!. I have played Spacewar!, but games from 1962-1980 can be a little hard to play, unless they are arcade-style. Games got really good and easy to play, in my opinion, during and after 1985. This happens to coincide with the appearance of the MS DOS for personal computers. This is when games got really beautiful, for the time, by introducing videos, and even some types of three-dimensional terrain.

If you want to talk good, older games, Pac-Man, which came out less than a year after Adventure, was a good one.

Adventure was good, and I can still remember spending hours trying to find the only Easter-egg in the game.

I love to play Battlefield 1942, it is the best FPS for me. I've never saw such level of gameplay in any other fps: if something was in a map, it was because you could use it. they were no useless decorative element.

See those boat in the background? you could drive them, even the aircraft carrier. this game is simply amazing. And this game is about 10 years old, those graphics are amazing !

Hilarious, this was my number one answer and decide to look to see if anyone else had posted it. Yours is post #3! LOL.

After BF2 was released, I got sucked into the BF2 Mod "Project Reality" where I stayed for 5 years, played nothing else; until I discovered the planet Kerbin.

Crimson Skies, may have something to do with the fact that it was one of the first games I've ever played

Another great one!

I want a new PS2 so I can play Scarface again.

We stiil play Tyson's Punchout sometimes on my brother's Wii.

I finished Mike Tysons boxing, a LONG time ago

If I wanted to post the first game I ever played, I would've posted Pokemon Silver for the GBC (Still have a functioning GBC and a dry battery cartridge), but I want to post my favorite. Here I go.

Because Bubsy 3D caused it to die, one of the things on my list to do before I die is to reboot the series, whether-or-not it may be decades old.

First PC game I ever bought, I played demo games from magazine coverdisks before this (floppies), and 8 and 16bit consoles/computers before that.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KzHcX5I_kFs

Managed to break my PC by putting C:\Frontier\frontier.exe in the autoexec.bat....
Besides Call of Duty 3 this is the only Call of duty game I have ever played and I loved it.
First game i bought to PC when i first got one. My old 133mhz .. Still collecting dust in the wardrobe. <3 But now with RedHat on it. And no powersupply.

A few of my favorites from years ago:

Dark Forces (And Jedi Knight I and II)

Earthsiege 1&2

Stars! - a game very few seem to know about or remember (it's a 4X game with a very simple interface)

wikipedia entry: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stars!

... Castle of the Winds, SimFarm, Commander Keen, SimTower...

PC gamer from birth, yo!

Does spore counts?

I don't think so then I'd pick super mario 64, the first video game I ever played.

EDIT: It doesn't... nvm
GTA San Andreas or Simcity 4 (Deluxe). No words can describe my love for those games.

Game?

Nope, can't do singular.

Imperium Gallactica II still comes out for a spin in skermish mode.

WarZone 2100 now available as open source http://wz2100.net/

I always have a yearning for Elder Scrolls: Morrowind, iirc my Morrowind directory + mods runs to over 10GB!

Finally, and possibly the best game you've never played: Vampire: The Masquerade Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Bloodlines http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampire:_The_Masquerade_%E2%80%93_Bloodlines

Honourable mention must go to DreamFall: The Longest Journey, if only because just thinking about it can make me cry.
